History.Action: P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - February 2, 2023
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - February 16, 2023
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor

Summary: This bill would co-name 129 thoroughfares and public places, based on requests of Council Members whose district includes the location.  Of these 129 co-names, 12 are either a relocation of a previously enacted co-naming or a revision to the street sign installed with respect to a previously enacted co-naming.
Text:

      Section 1. The following intersection name, in the Borough of Queens, is hereby designated as hereafter indicated.
